decision_conditions: <p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt; line-height: 1.38;">Prior to commencement of works, a Flood Risk Statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, such a statement shall consider and identify the potential flood risks at this site (existing and post-development) and provide appropriate flood mitigate measures.&nbsp;to mitigate against the flood risk to future occupants. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved which shall be maintained in perpetuity.</p><p dir="ltr" style="margin-top: 10pt; margin-bottom: 10pt; line-height: 1.38;">REASON: To address and mitigate the impacts of flood risk.</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>The development shall be undertaken in full accordance with the conditions set out in the relevant part of Schedule 2, part 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).</p><p>REASON: To comply with the requirements of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).</p>

<p>Any development permitted to be used as a dwellinghouse is to remain in use as a dwellinghouse within the meaning of Class C3 of Schedule 2 to the Use Classes Order and for no other purpose, except to the extent that the other purpose is ancillary to the use as a dwellinghouse.</p><p>REASON: To comply with the requirements of MA.2. (6)</p>
description: Prior approval for change of use from Commercial (Use Class E) to one residential unit at basement and ground floor (Use Class C3).
